title: Introduction
text: order use package, may wish adjust parameters LimeSurvey API (user name, LimeSurvey instance, etc.). parameters necessary retrieve data test production LimeSurvey instance saved config.yml file. next console shows default parameters test instance. use production parameters (OES server), set R_CONFIG_ACTIVE production.
code: default:   tmp.server: "semiotikon"   api_url: "http://www.semiotikon.de/lime2/index.php/admin/remotecontrol"   tmp.user: "limeremote"   tmp.credential: "IWBD3SnMfxcu" Sys.setenv(R_CONFIG_ACTIVE = "test")

title: Introduction
text: Limer_GetMaster() function returns name master template. parameter template missing, function returns master templates. latter used retrieve meta data master templates: get_MasterMeta() function returns metadata specific master template. next console underlines, needs surveyID name survey. function returns variable names text LimeSurvey API. get_AllMasterMeta() wrapper function get_MasterMeta returns metadata master templates LimeSurvey. parameter export = TRUE function exports data Excel file. file used create meta data master templates. report template contains variables names matched manual meta data, function appends variables names LimeSurvey matched. Thus, result create_metadata shows templates without errors (columns filled) templates errors (variables names text listed). example, last console showed template rpt_elt_p1 contains errors. file shows variables matched.
code: #Load the package library(MetaMaster)  #Get master template for all school types #mastertemplatesdf <- get_MasterTemplate() mastertemplatesdf <- Limer_GetMaster(template = FALSE) head(mastertemplatesdf) #Get metadata for a specific master template get_MasterMeta(id = "197865",                name = "master_01_bfr_allg_gm_elt_00_2022_v4") #Get metadata for all master templates #get_AllMasterMeta(export = TRUE)

title: Introduction
text: Finally, package provides function create new survey based master template. send_survey() function needs path master template name new survey.

title: Introduction
Authors and Citation
text: Edgar Treischl. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Treischl E (2024). MetaMaster: Master Meta Data Universe. R package version 0.0.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {MetaMaster: Be the Master of the Meta Data Universe},   author = {Edgar Treischl},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1}, }

what: Be the Master of the Meta Data Universe
title: Be the Master of the Meta Data Universe
text: goal MetaMaster package create meta data LimeSurvey reproducible, tested, consequence error-free. package provides functions get names master templates, data master template, create new surveys based template.

title: Be the Master of the Meta Data Universe
text: can install development version MetaMaster like :
code: # install_local from installs the package and its dependencies remotes::install_local("MetaMaster.gz",                        dependencies = TRUE)

title: Be the Master of the Meta Data Universe
text: Limer_GetMaster() function returns master template LimeSurvey. function returns survey templates declared master_ limesurvey instance. Moreover, set template argument TRUE get survey templates. latter comes meta data list. Since know master template, can retrieve survey question via API. function get_MasterMeta() returns survey questions given master template. function takes survey ID (sid) name survey (name) arguments. Moreover, function testrun() takes input list survey templates master templates merges results list. latter wrapper function around purrr::map2() joinMetaGisela(), next console shows first five survey master templates. Share results test run send_testrun() function. function sends results test run via email.
code: #Let's get started library(MetaMaster) Sys.setenv(R_CONFIG_ACTIVE = "test") df <- Limer_GetMaster(template = TRUE) head(df) get_MasterMeta(id = df$sid[1],                 name = df$surveyls_title[1]) testrun(export = TRUE) #Join the meta data with the LimeSurvey API for all survey and master templates purrr::map2(df$sid[1:5],             df$surveyls_title[1:5],             get_MasterMeta) #Send the test run send_testrun(sendto = "john.doe@johndoe.com")

title: Be the Master of the Meta Data Universe
text: Create new file update_allMastersLimeSurvey() function. latter runs get_MasterTemplate() returns masters templates saves result Excel file.
code: Limer_GetMasterData(export = TRUE) buildMetaMaster(path = "MasterData_2024_11_11.xlsx", export = TRUE) send_testrun(sendto = "johndoe@doe.com")
